https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/63108/ : SUCCESS
I think , it is not ignoring right ? opertaion is not allowed here. please update commit message documentation accordingly.
avoid these details from commit message.

Key point need to look here is user initiate Dump request failure path hadling. Added few places. please beytter design to handle the failure Status flag reset.  Otherwise any failure is going to stop getter usre initated dump, going to be bigger issue for debug.

> Key point need to look here is user initiate Dump request failure path hadling. Added few places. please beytter design to handle the failure Status flag reset.  Otherwise any failure is going to stop getter usre initated dump, going to be bigger issue for debug.
Need to reset the flag here.
Need to reset the flag here also.
we may have one call back and type can be passed as a parameter right?
Why we need this , Dump manager is single threaded application.
as we are doing fork and this variable is accessed in interprocess we need mutex
passing pointer to a local variable?

Looks, Your intention is, "Don't allow new user-requested BMC dump if another user-requested BMC type dump is in the progress to collect but, allow other types of BMC dump"

Please update the commit message accordingly, it is confusing since PDC supports different types of BMC and Host dumps.

are you wondering about the dump manager consuming more CPU resources when multiple dumps collection happen in parallel? If so, what about other type of dumps? Or you are adding for some other reason? can you please elaborate?
other dumps happens only on error but this type user can trigger using GUI.

So the caller need to take action like reattempt after sometime or it depends the user? I think, we are returning `NotAllowed` for different reason too, so do we need to care about new error code for this?
New error code means changes here and also the redfish, "Not allowed" error with reason should be good enough for the user to know, as the error message will be displayed to the user.

> New error code means changes here and also the redfish,

If the end-user needs to take some action then, we need to make a change in the Redfish as well. If no action required by the end-user then, I am fine.
I think you need to cover all error cases between creation and collection to reset the added flag `fUserDumpInProgress` else permanently the dump manager won't allow the user requested BMC dump.
Please add that allocation deleted at the callback function.
is it correct, the `captureDump()` might called for some other types of BMC dump but, you are treating it as `UserRequested`, you need to use `type` variable, right?
wow good catch i intended to assign with type

- Why new a class member for this? Cannot we use the `Status` property to get to know the dump state? that's already implemented for the BMC dump, right?. https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/blob/ff92ffe29db4099fa44864fc22f40843f4ca1834/dump_entry.hpp#L26

- Looks, Your intention is, "Don't allow ONLY the new user-requested BMC dump if another user-requested BMC type dump is in the progress to collect" but, the BMC dump manager does not know the type of BMC dump since it did not add in the BMC dump entries so (I guess) that's why you are adding the special member.

- Cannot we add that BMC dump type in the BMC Dump entry interface and implement and use it in the BMC dump manager and slove what you are trying to do instead of adding the member and maintaining the state inside the program because the state in the program won't solve the problem if dump-manager restarts for some reason. (it will solve if we added into BMC dump entry since we preserved the dump details and restored those details when the dump manager starts).
JS: Please add issue details in the comment as TODO, I guess that process is following in the PDC repo.
Instead of setting status as false in failure palce you can throw exception and and set at one place in line 159 by moving 159 in try catch block?  all the places call elginternal failure.
Incase dreport fail to create dump file with some reason , with this fix, User initiated dump request is completely blocked. is this path is tested?

sd_event_add_child is added on the process id of the child process that is forked to create the dump file, and not on the actual dump file. If the child process ix EXITED/STOPPED the callback method is called which will clear the flag.

I guess we are safe here.

----child becoming zombie---
If the child process becomes a zombie, i,e if the parent phosphor-debug-collector crashes when child is generating dump, we are safe as the flag is reset when phosphor-debug-collector restarts.

---child process hang for ever---
do not see this happening as we do not have a loop logic, so it got to end with either success/failure
It is better to reset this variable at common place , create dump itself right ? catching excption at create dump context , that is more readable.
yeah better, i should have thought of it
Instead "Already in progress" sort of error eis more meaningfull here.
A few suggestions and queries only
Can we use unique pointer here to avoid manual new? We can release the pointer to call back method to delete it
this code is removed in next commit
Can we use an unique pointer here to avoid manual delete?
this code is removed in next commit adding it as this is defect fix in downstream
A query only. Also the build is failed
set this at the  end of the function
as per review i need to do try catch and set the flag to false if in case of exception
that change is not needed if you are setting the flag at the end right?
better to use c++ style cast?
Can we use an unique pointer here?
I don't think so, since we need explicit allocation and deallocation is required for this pointer
this code is removed in next commit https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/+/55008/14 and using better approach
